loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 59 years old, married and supports her child who is still in school. She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of over 15 years and her monthly income is KES. 15,000.
She is now requesting her second loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stocks of fresh bread, sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat and cereals. The profits she earns will be used to plough back to business.
Her dream is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, rice, and fresh bread for her retail store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling soft drinks .She has been in this business for 10 years selling to all types of people on a retail and wholesale basis. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits. She works six days out of every week in a shop that she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to start supplying fruit juice to other shops and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and passion fruits.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood of CPG, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.fr: Dorothée est une dame âgée de 44 ans, divorcée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 12 et 18 an. elle mène une activité de vente de céréales dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans déjà. ceci dire elle bénéfice d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des sacs d'arachides et de pistaches pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses capacités de vente. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille devenus trop important depuis son divorce.
texts.en: Dorothée is a 44-year old lady, who is divorced and mother to three children, whose ages range between 12 and 18 years old. She has been selling cereals in one of the town's markets for the past 15 years and thus enjoys good experience in this field. With this loan she would like to buy sacks of groundnut and pistachios in order to boost her stock of goods and consequently her sales capacity. The income she generates will allow her to provide better for her family's needs, which have become too heavy since her divorce.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jean Rene

texts.fr: Jean est un homme camerounais de 41 ans.Marié et père de 05 enfants dont le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé 08 mois, Jean  fait essentiellement dans la vente de boissons hygiéniques depuis 03 ans.son stock de marchandise étant moindre, Jean souhaite acheter les boissons hygiéniques afin de renforcer son stocks et également quelques produits alimentaires afin de diversifier ses activités et augmenter ses bénéfices. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et lui permettront également d'assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Jean is a 41-year old man from Cameroon. He is married and father to five children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest eight months. Jean has mainly been selling hygienic drinks for the past three years, but as his stock of goods has fallen he would like to buy more hygienic drinks so that he can boost it again and also buy some food products so that he can diversify his business and increase his profits. The profits he makes will be reinvested in his business and will also enable him to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy hygienic drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock (drinks, crates of beer, juice and food products).

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Nisreen is a 31-year-old conservative woman. She has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. Nisreen is a mother of three. Her husband has his own business of selling mobile phones to support the family. Nisreen is applying for a loan to purchase more mobile phones and their accessories for him to sell.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag, who is 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her father-in law-has two houses on his fenced land and she, together with her family, lives in one of the houses. She has been working as a hairdresser at her own barbershop for eleven years and during this time she has attracted quite a number of people to her business as well as accumulated vast amounts of experience in this service field. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase new furniture for her home. As a result, her family will live in a more comfortable place and this will motivate her and her husband to work even harder and more enthusiastically. The borrower is one of our organization's trustworthy clients and has paid her previous loan's installment debt in due time.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is applying for a loan of 29,000 PHP to purchase more groceries and ingredients to sell in her general store.  This business, that was previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) and Kiva, continues to provide for Susan and her family with an increased income and continues to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Khasa

texts.en:
Khasa is a 53-year-old from Imishli. She has 3 children. Khasa has been raising cattle for the past 20 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but her brother is helping her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the market. Khasa has 5 daughters and believes she must work very hard in order to help with her daughters’ weddings. 

Khasa usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens and sells them in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is about 250 AZN. This is the only income source for the family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its frequent use in everyday meals.

Khasa is applying for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy 4 calves and 2 cows. This is going to be her first loan with Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy four calves and two cows.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile. Eman is a married woman from Jabalia. She lives in a simple house with her husband and two sons. Her husband works for a low wage, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

She is requesting a 2,517 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer Eman comfortable furniture so she can enjoy living in her house.

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy new living room furniture for the family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy garden tools, seeds and fertilisers in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man living in Rafah city with his wife. For the past 2 years, he has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. 

He would like to buy a new taxi but he needed some money to pay the remaining cost of the car. Mohammad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him pay the remaining cost of the taxi.  Mohammad appears in the photo next to his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the remaining cost of the taxi.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala is a 48-year-old single mother. For 10 years Lala has been operating her store. She usually sells products daily. There are tea, sugar, rice, candy, sauces, beans and other food items in her store. Single-handedly she has been managing this store and believes it is fun to have good contacts with customers.

Lala’s store is in the central market of Agjabadi. There are daily customers who come to purchase the items they need. Her monthly income from the business is about 250 AZN. With the money she gets from store she takes care of her parents and also supports her relatives financially. She is a person who always works hard in order to achieve more.

Lala has taken a loan once before from Aqroinvest. She has applied for a second loan of 1,800 AZN. With this money she plans to purchase more products, because very soon there is a big spring holiday. Nowruz is coming and a lot of customers purchase goods.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase sales.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann, along with her husband, have been earning a living through fishing for more than two years now. Rose Ann works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan to buy a boat engine with which her husband will be able enhance his catch thus enabling them to sell more fish in the market. Rose Ann dreams of expanding their business in the future to generate more income necessary for the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is a 35-year-old woman from a small village of Terjola district. She is married and lives with her husband, her 9-year-old daughter, her 11-year-old son, and her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. Her husband works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have two milk cows which Eka milks and uses to produce cheese products to sell at local markets. Besides this they have a vineyard with 1000 samples of wine trees and a hectare of agricultural land. They harvest grapes and produce wine and Georgian Vodka to sell at a good price. 

Eka has requested a loan so that she can start trading in clothing. She plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and resell them with a price markup. This will increase the family's income which will enable them to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Novy

texts.en: This time, Novy is borrowing Php 20,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. Her general store business was previously funded through NWTF, and Kiva continues to provide her and her family with increased income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en: Aghavni is a 50-year-old widow. She lives in the Khvilisi village of Akhaltsikhe district with her 22-year-old son. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular they own a plot of land where they grow potatoes and some vegetables. The harvested products are sold locally at the markets. Aghvani has requested a loan to purchase potatoes for seeding. She will work hard the whole season and hopes that she gets a good harvest. She plans to use the profit for reinvesting in her agricultural business. This loan will help the family to develop their business, earn more income and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for seeding.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is a 34-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a government employee. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Saima is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

She is a member of a 7-person group and has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to grow her business by purchasing clothing, needles and other stitching materials. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to increase her net income and be able to save for their future. Saima dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, needles and other stitching materials for her business.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 46 years old. He has 3 children. Mahmud grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables and fruits. He says that even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for 16 years without any difficulty. 

Mahmud sells his vegetables and fruits in the bazaar. His income from sales is about 200 AZN a month. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to the increased sales in the coming summer, because people purchase fruit a lot.

He has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN at Aqroinvest. This loan will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo instead. This picture has been taken in his barber shop.

Faten is a 24-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small village near Jabalia city. Faten's husband has been running his own barber shop for three years. He needs some money to improve his shop by adding new furniture.

Faten has requested a loan of 2,000 USD from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Faten's husband to improve his barber shop and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Gracita

texts.en: Gracita is 30 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gracita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gracita has requested for a loan of 14,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy paint and hardwood to repair her fishing boat. Gracita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gracita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy paint and hardwood to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Margrait's Group

texts.en:
Margrait is a 45-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a government employee. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Margrait is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

She is a member of a 2-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to grow her business by purchasing clothing, needles and other stitching materials. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to increase her net income. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of stitching materials for her business.

loans.name: Jelena

texts.en:
Jelena is 25 years old and comes from a vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is married and has one boy who is 4 years old. Jelena works in a kindergarten and her husband works as a driver. Many people from these minority communities in Kosovo, such as Jelena’s and her family, live in extremely poor conditions. They lack access to proper nutrition and care, as well as being exposed to unsanitary conditions. 

The money that she and her husband generate is not enough to cover all of the daily living expenses. Although keeping food on the table is difficult at this time, Jelena remains optimistic. She is always smiling. 

The toilet that they have is very old. Jelena recently requested a loan to improve her family's living conditions, starting with renovating the toilet. She promises she will repay the loan on time. She is very grateful to the KIVA lenders for improving her family’s living conditions and contributing to her child’s overall health.

loans.use: To renovate the toilet.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en: Janepher is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She also takes care of an additional family member (young brother). She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. She sells door to door. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and acquiring a permanent business location. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Juan Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Wilfredo es casado, tiene 34 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, tiene 3 hijos y dos de ellos estan estudiando, el se dedica a la reparacion y venta de telefonos celulares. Inicio este negocio trabajando para un amigo, actualmente lleva 5 años de experiencia en este negocio. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la sastreria.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para la reparacion de celulares y para comprar celulares para la venta. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda formal y en un buen punto de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Juan Wilfredo is married, 34 years of age, he has a high school education, and he has three children, two of whom are studying. He repairs and sells cell phones. He started in this business working for a friend and currently has five years of experience. He can also count on help from his wife, who works as a tailor. 

Juan Wilfredo is applying for a loan which he will use to purchase cell phones to sell and replacement parts for repairing other phones. In the future he would like to establish his own shop in a nice location in the city.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts and cell phones.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es: Ana se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maiz y frijol, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos (8 y 15 años) en casa propia, ella solicita un credito para comprar insumos agricolas y alquilar una parcela para poder seguir sembrando y obtener mejores ganacias para poder darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  She lives with her husband and two children (ages 8 and 15) in their own home.  

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to also rent a plot of land; this is so that she can continue planting and make better profits in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira is 26-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and two children. Her husband is an employee of a medicine factory. As his income is insufficient to meet the family's needs she is trying to help him by stitching clothes. She is a tailor. 

Sumaira is a member of 7 person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to grow her business by purchasing a new tailoring machine. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to increase her net income and to be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. Note: In the picture Sumaira raises her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells fried fish in Eguafo near Elmina. Ama has received no formal education. She is single and has 8 children. 

Ama has been selling fried fish for some time now. She is responsible for supporting herself and paying her children's school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of fish to fry and sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her fish selling trade.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fish to fry, and sell, in the market.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells used clothing in Eguafo near Elmina. Monica has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children. Monica has been selling used clothing for some time now. She is responsible for helping to support her husband to pay their family’s general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital base and buy more used clothing to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells kenkey dumplings, made with mashed corn, and fish in Eguafo, near Elmina. 

Esi has received no formal education. She is married with five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Esi has been selling her kenkey dumplings with fish for some time now. She helps support her husband's efforts to provide for the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase corn to prepare her kenkey dumpling recipe and to buy fish to sell. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her food-selling business further.

loans.use: to purchase corn to prepare her kenkey dumpling recipe and to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells yams and oranges in Eguafo near Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to help her husband in paying the family's general bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of yams and oranges to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to expand her trade.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of yams and oranges to sell in the market.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene la edad 46 de  años, está casada y vive con su hija y un nieto. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y además el  concentrado para el engorde de los mismos. Ella cuenta con las instalaciones  para dicha actividad y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miriam is forty-six years old, is married, and lives with her daughter and grandson.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy pigs and the feed that fattens them.  

She has all the facilities for this activity, and she gives the pigs this feed in order to fatten them more quickly.  She wants to have her animals at an ideal weight in order to later sell them in the local market or in neighboring towns.  She wants to generate the most profits for her well-being and she also wants to grow her pig-raising project.  

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks; FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
Zohrab is 39 years old, married and has three children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Zohrab breeds sheep for meat and wool, and serves local butchers. He has more than ten years of experience in this field, thank to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. He receives a pension from the government every month, but it is too low to cover the family's costs.

Zohrab usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in 4 to 6 months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock market. Selling mutton and wool brings in about 180 AZN per month. Meat is a very popular product in Azerbaijan since people use it in national dishes, such as pilaf and dolma. 

He is the sole provider of his family and does not make enough income to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Zohrab is requesting a 2000 AZN loan to purchase twenty sheep and fodder. This will be his second loan from AqroInvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy twenty sheep and fodder

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 46-year-old woman, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and three sons. She is a farmer and has been raising  seasonal fruits and vegetables for seven years. She chose this business because it is profitable, and fresh food is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on the table of every Azerbaijan family, and they are also used to make fresh punch. Jamila sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband is on a pension, and he actively helps to raise her crops. As these products are in high demand, Jamila wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her second loan, and she has a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer, to grow fruit and vegetables to sell in the central bazaar.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en: Revaz is 24 years old. He lives in Tsetskhlauri village, Kobuleti District, with his 24-year-old wife, their 2-year-old son, and his parents. The family owns a plot of agricultural land, four milk cows and four calves. Revaz’s wife and his mother milk the cows every day to make dairy products. He and his father cultivate the land, where they sow maize, and they also have nut trees. All the harvested products, and the dairy products, are sold locally in the market, and the family receives a small monthly income. With this loan, Revaz wants to buy a milk cow, which also be used for milking and making dairy products. He plans to develop his farming and reinvest the profits in the business. The loan will help Revaz to achieve better living conditions and to provide a better future for his young  son.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 55 years old. She lives with her 33-year-old son, Kakhaber, in a small village in Gardabani district, East Georgia. Kakhaber works at the railway station and receives a monthly income. Mariam is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has milk cows and calves; the milk is used in dairy products. Mariam produces and sells dairy products at local markets. She applied for a loan to buy two milk cows. After buying the cows, she will be able to produce more dairy products to sell. A small part of the loan will be used to renovate her cattle-shed, which will enable Mariam to have more cattle in the future. This will cause the family income  to increase. With the increased income, they will be able to live in better conditions. Mariam awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and renovate her cattle-shed.

loans.name: Oriku Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 25 years old. His farming business doing well. He completed paying off his previous loan due to a good harvest in the last season as well as better pricing of the produce.

Charles has since leased a bigger portion of land in which he intends to grow more maize and wheat. He has acquired another loan of 75,000 KES which will facilitate in land preparation for the upcoming planting season.

He plans to use the proceed to pay for school fees for his child. His hope and dream is to become a large scale commercial farmer.

loans.use: to prepare his farm for maize and wheat farming.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 63 years old and married to Dinah, who also helps provide for the upkeep of the family through subsistence farming. He supports a family of 10 people. He and his wife are blessed with nine children between 11 and 33 years old. For the past six years, Joel has run a business of buying and selling green tea leaves. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

Joel is now requesting a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. He wishes to use this amount to purchase green tea leaves for resale. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and purchase more green tea leaves.

His dream is to own tea plantations someday.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Georgena

texts.en:
Georgena sells the local favorite dish, 'kenkey', in Eguafo near Elmina. 'Kenkey' is a mashed corn dough usually wrapped in banana leaves and eaten with pepper sauce or meat. Georgena has received no formal education.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.

 Georgena has been selling her 'kenkey' for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of corn to prepare her kenkey and sell it in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her 'kenkey'-selling trade.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of corn to prepare her 'kenkey' recipe.

loans.name: Safeena's Group

texts.en: Safeena is a 43-year-old, hard-working, woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and eight children. Her husband owns a hotel. His income is not sufficient to meet the family's needs, so she is trying to help him cover their needs by sewing clothes. She is a tailor. She will extend her business in the future if she gets good profits. Safeena is a member of a three-person group, and she has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to grow her business by purchasing a new tailoring machine. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to increase her net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine for her business.

loans.name: Paragogous Group

texts.en:
Nora, age 46, is a single mother, and she has five children, all in business on their own. She lives in the Accra metropolis. 
Nora and the seven other group members have worked for several years in their various businesses in and around Teshie community. They sell basic products, such as provisions, soft drinks, eggs, wax prints, plastic products, fish, vegetables, cosmetics, yams, and kids’ dresses. They have now decided to form a group of eight in order to take out a loan. The group is called Paragogous Group. In the photo, Nora is standing second from the left.
Nora is applying for GHS 1300, Vida for GHS 1200, Christiana for GHS 600, Grace for GHS 800, Beatrice for GHS 750, Setina for GHS 300, Charwy for GHS 300 and Elizabeth for GHS 250, for a total of GHS 5,500. They are applying for the loans to buy more items to sell to their customers. This is their second loan with KIVA. Nora's goal for the future is to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to customers, including eggs, milo, milk, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seedlings for planting and matooke (steamed green bananas) for resale.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 19 years old and a married woman. She is a housewife and mother of two sons. She belongs to a poor family. She is facing a very tough time because currently, her husband is jobless. Her husband wants to start a vegetable selling business. For that reason,  as a member of a 7-person group, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase fresh vegetables from the field and sell them in the market. She hopes that this business will be a productive one for her family. She dreams of providing quality education to her children. She is very grateful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard is from Yerevan town, and lives with her mother, sister, and daughter Sofya (in the photo). Silvard works at a local company, but the income is hardly enough to cover the family's basic expenses.

Silvard's daughter, Sofya, studies architecture and construction design at Yerevan State University.  She is a very hardworking young lady with a purposeful future, so Silvard works hard to cover her education costs. 

Since it is very difficult for Silvard to save money to cover her daughter's tuition, she has applied for this loan. Silvard will pay the university tuition, and will give Sofya an opportunity to complete her education and become a good designer.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Toilou Lom Group

texts.en:
“Life is a gift so one has to cherish it,” shares Tingjahat, who is a member of Toilou Lom and the featured profile member with the raised hand. She’s blessed with kids and grandkids. Her struggles to manage household expenses taught her to be prudent and practical. She grows vegetables in her paddy fields and sells them in the market place. Her produce includes yams, pumpkins, cucumbers, corn, beans, peas, etc. The bowl in the picture contains the seeds and small plants of vegetables which she will grow.  She’s been in this business for the past 30 years, since she lacked education and capital to start a big business like running a variety store.

She looks forward to this Kiva loan to buy piglets to raise and sell to make good money. She will also continue her vegetable-selling business besides raising the piglets. Tingjahat’s only wish is to provide education for all her grandkids, which she failed to accomplish for her kids, due to poor financial conditions of the family. She hopes to get a profit by selling the fully grown pigs and send her grandkids to a good institute. She believes that a time will come when all her grandkids will stand on their own feet without having to follow in their grandparents’ footsteps of farming for their living. That is her wish and desire for her future but she also takes very keen interest in what she is doing at present to bring her wishes into reality. 

 “A home is where the heart is,” says Tingjahat and highlights the need for building a house which she can call a home. She is happy that WSDS will support and assist her in achieving her purpose and says she will always remain grateful for all the things WSDS has done for her.

Similarly, most of the members are engaged in piggery and some of them run 'paan dukan' stores.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and eventually sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Ekua sells provisions in Eguafo near Elmina and has done so for some time now. Her husband is a pig farmer in their community. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees and other general family expenses. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to expand her provisions shop further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a 41 years old. She is philologist (studies language), and works in one of the leading schools of Yerevan as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. Besides teaching in school, she teaches the Armenian language privately in her house with pupils. Anahit has a good reputation as teacher, and has many pupils.

Anahit is married, and lives with her husband, son and two daughters in Parakar village, Armavir region. Her husband is a cargo carrier, and works day and night to support his family. Anahit’s elder daughter is a freshman at Yerevan State University, studying Romance and Germanic Philology. She dreams of becoming as good a philologist as her mother, and she understands that for this dream, she needs to put more efforts in studying. But besides studying for this dream, financing is also very necessary. 

Therefore,  Anahit is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to pay her daughter's tuition.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old and married. He buys tea leaves from the local suppliers and sells them to the main tea factory, which he has been doing for five years.  He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Peter is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD for 60,000 KES LTD, which he will use to purchase more stock of tea leaves from farmers and increase the number of bags he sells. The increased profit will be used to repay the loan as well as for his family's welfare.  His dream is to improve his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria es casada, tiene 43 años de edad, cursó 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo ayudando a sus padres y hasta la fecha  lleva 13 años de experiencia.
Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo ya que va a comprar hilos de diferentes clase y colores para poder tejer sus productos, en el futro desea ver su negocio y su producción mucho mas grande de lo que ahora es.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria is married, and 43 years old. She has two years of primary education. Rosa Maria has four children, one of whom is attending school.

She earns her living as a weaver. She started out by helping her parents and now has thirteen years of experience. 

Now Rosa Maria is seeking a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy different types and colours of yarn for her weaving. In the future she wishes to see her business and production grow bigger than than they are today.

loans.use: buy yarn for weaving

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (roupas, polony, frangos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja melhorar as condições da sua residência e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é arranjar uma fonte de rendimento para acrescentar a sua receita e a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Alice is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. She lives her own home and is not financially responsible for anyone else.
She has a business selling a variety of goods, and she plans to use this loan to purchase merchandise (clothing, chickens, etc.) to increase her stock.
In the future she hopes to improve her house and build a commercial space. She is committed to paying off this loan so she can apply for further loans from Hluvuku. 
Her greatest challenges are figuring out a way to increase her income and the lack of funds available to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: to buy products (clothing, chickens, etc.) to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets and other jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jeduras

texts.en:
Jedurasi is a married woman with five children; her husband is a drunkard who can’t support his children, so she has been struggling and has managed to start up a banana (plantain) selling business. She first took a loan of UGX 600,000, and has repaid it. 

She is now asking for UGX 800,000 to pay tuition for the children, and to boost her business. Her challenges are price fluctuation, and clients who sometimes refuse to pay.

She hopes she will get enough profits from her business to repay the loan. She is resilient and committed.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 38 años es una madre de 3 hijos a quienes brinda el mejor de su esmero, comparte una vida conyugal junto a Alberto de 39 años.Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Anteriormente se dedicaba a las actividades agropecuarias concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad. Posteriormente al obtener capital suficiente optó por incursionar en la venta de abono orgánico y demás insumos para el campo.Lleva 5 años en este rubro y desde entonces ha logrado consolidarlo y convertirlo en un buen negocio ,gracias a la comercialización de guano de aves y fertilizantes naturales los cuales poseen buena demanda en su localidad.
Le agrada su labor puesto que es un trabajo algo más sencillo que el campo pero con mucha entrega de por medio puesto que debe en ocasiones viajar a la ciudad de Lima para que ella misma supervise el traslado de su pedido.A manera de contar con capital de trabajo para seguir desempeñando su labor acude a su entidad financiera.Su objetivo a largo plazo es la compra de una movilidad para el traslado de su mercadería .Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y posteriormente expenderlo a los agricultores de su localidad.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old and has 3 children to whom she dedicates all her care. She shares her life with her partner, Alberto, who is 39 years old. They have a house together made of hardwoods where they share their daily lives. Previously, she had been working in the fields harvesting cacao and organic coffee. After getting together enough investment capital she was able to start selling organic fertilizer and other farming supplies. She has been working on her business for 5 years and since then has been able to consolidate and convert it into a good business, thanks to commercializing bird guano and natural fertilizers that are in high demand in her area. 
She is thankful for her work because it is easier than working in the fields but still requires a lot of effort because occasionally she needs to travel to Lima to supervise the transfer of her orders. She needs working capital to be able to continue growing her business she is coming to this financial institution. Her long term goal is to purchase a vehicle in order to move her product. She needs 400 dollars in order to purchase more organic fertilizer and then she will sell it to local farms.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Divorciada e mãe de 6 filhos 2 ainda continuam a frequentar Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ele.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos de primeira necessidade. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, feijão, frangos, peixe, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir manter se saudável para poder alcançar os seus objectivos.
texts.en:
Julieta is married and has six children, two of whom are still in school. She lives in her own home and also supports her grandchildren, who live with her.
She has a business selling a variety of staple goods. She will use this loan to buy products (flour, beans, chickens, fish, stock, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
In the future she hopes to continue to expand her business. She is committed to paying off her loan so that she can request further loans from Hluvuku. 
Her greatest challenge is to stay healthy so she can reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy products (flour, beans, chickens, fish, stock, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 56 years old and comes from a small village of the Gardabani district. She is married and lives with her 32-year-old son, 35-year-old daughter and an infant grandson. Her daughter is a tailor; she gets orders and sews different kinds of dresses and earns money. 

Lorena is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow and hens. She milks the cow and produces dairy products. Lorena sells the dairy products and eggs at local markets at a good price. She requested a loan for purchasing three calves. After purchasing the calves, she will raise them and resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income she will make better living conditions for her family members. Lorena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and resell at higher price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tools and construction materials

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sara, es una clienta casada, tiene dos hijos adolecentes, estudiantes que buscan como progresar en la vida y doña Sara les poya incondicionalmente en los gastos de escuela y alimentación con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja de conductor y con los ingresos del pequeño negocio de ropa y calzado que tienen en la actualidad, este crédito que solicita es para la construcción de otro cuarto en su hogar para ofrecerles su propio espacio a sus hijos, comprara cemento, arena hierro, perlines, laminas de zinc y la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sara, a married client, has two teenage children who are students looking to get ahead in life.  Sara supports them unconditionally with their school expenses and food, with the help of her husband, who works as a driver, and with income from the small clothing and footwear business they currently run.

This loan she's requesting is to build another room in her house to give her children their own space.  She's going to buy cement, sand, rebar, support beams, and corrugated metal sheets, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Azal Group

texts.en:
Azal group consists of six ladies from Hadramout, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 260,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment.

Majida is 49 years old and lives with her family in Hadramout, Yemen. She has started up a business of selling perfumes and clothes. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. She decided one year ago to help her family and earn some money to provide better living conditions for her children. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to keep her business running and expand it. She looks forward to making large profits and starting accumulating money to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes for her business

loans.name: Al-Bsma Group

texts.en:
Al-Bsma group consists of five ladies from Hadramout, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB. They intend to use this loan to expand their businesses.

Suad is 53 years old and a married woman. She is the leader of the group. Since she is uneducated and can't find another job, she decided to sell cosmetics, perfumes and such.  She is a hardworking woman.

She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy cosmetics, perfumes and such, then sell them to improve her living conditions and to send her children to school to become educated and have better future than her own. She wishes to make a profit from selling products and accumulate enough money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and such

loans.name: Mansah

texts.en:
Mansah is married and has one child. She has received no formal education. Mansah sells cassava in Eguafo near Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. 

Mansah uses her income to help her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Mansah will use the loan to purchase more onions and cassava to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mansah plans to grow her onion and cassava trade.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and cassava to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mediatrix

texts.en:
Mediatrix is a 36-year-old married lady who is blessed with four children aged between 18 and eight years old. She has a tailoring business that has now been in operation for 10 years and earns her a monthly income of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She has been given a second loan of 30,000 KES by KADET LTD and wishes to purchase textiles and other sewing materials for her business. The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and expand her tailoring business.

Mediatrix's dream is to live a happy life.

loans.use: To stock more textiles

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is widow and has no dependents; she has no formal education. Maame has been selling local "powders" and "butters" in Eguafo near Elima; she has been doing this for quite a while. 

Maame uses her income to support herself, and pay all her own expenses. 

Maame will use the loan to purchase more "powders" and "butters" to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to to expand her trade further.

loans.use: to purchase more "powders" and "butters" to sell.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta sells a traditional corn and cassava dough called banku in Eguafo near Elmina, Ghana. She has no formal education and is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer while Benedicta has been selling her banku recipe for some time now. She pays to support her husband with their family’s general accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to prepare banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her banku enterprise further.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare traditional dough.

loans.name: Vivincia

texts.en:
Vivincia is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, married and has five children who are all in school.

Vivincia has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for three years and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Zarqalam

texts.en:
Zarqalam is 37 years old with 3 children. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 7 years now. She is very hardworking and passionate in her work. She considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and fruit trees with her husband. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to earn profits in order to support her family. 

Zarqalam’s income from her business is 350 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future her son will help her to grow the business bigger. Since her vegetable and fruit business is a profitable and fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

She has already taken out 2 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for a third loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money, she wants to invest in the business and buy more fruit trees in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to plant more fruit in order to increase her revenue

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine owns and operates a traditional chop bar in Eguafo near Elmina. Catherine sells a variety of local favorite dishes at her eatery. Catherine has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Catherine has been operating her chop bar for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase more ingredients needed to operate her chop bar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her chop bar operations further.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients needed to operate her chop bar.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is 43 years old, married to Muinde, who contributes to the family income. She has been a commercial farmer for a period of about three years, with a monthly income of approximately KES 20,000.

This is Nduku's third loan, after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy farm input. She hopes to be a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a hog raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a computer gaming business. Mary Jane is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en:
Abdulla is 55 years old and has three children. For the past 18 years, he has been raising cattle and selling their milk. Milk is a very popular drink among local people. They prepare different products from it, such as yogurt and cheese. These products are in high demand because of their health benefits.

Abdulla is a retired person with an income of 250 AZN from this business. His son is helping him in running the business. Regardless of the difficulties of raising cattle, Abdulla is a very positive man. He really counts on his son to expand the business and make it bigger in the future. He has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN from Aqroinvest, in order to buy two calves and a cow. He has plans to expand the business and to meet the high demand for milk in the market.

loans.use: to buy two calves and a cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a retail shop business in Tala town.She has been in the business for the past three years and it has been profitable. She is 37 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell, including cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and rice. She anticipates generating more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to grow her retail shop and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 27-year-old, conservative married woman, so her husband appears in the photo instead. Nadia is a mother for three. She has a few goats that she raises to use their milk in making yogurt and cheese to sell. Now Nadia is applying for a youth loan to bring more goats and sheep.

loans.use: to bring more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in Samburu, Kenya.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy items to sell in her general store business, like biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc.

Wanza has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from a milk shop.

Wanza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 53 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Beatriz has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Rinal

texts.en: Rinal is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two boys. Her husband owns a supermarket. Rinal took a loan previously to enhance her fitness center business. Now she is applying for a loan to enhance her other business, which is selling kitchen products and cosmetics. She will use the loan to bring more goods to the shop.

loans.use: to bring more goods to the shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is now 47 years old. He now earns a monthly income of KES 35,000 which he uses to support his family. Joseph is applying for his fifth loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET).  

He will use the loan to purchase more goats, cows, and sheep for resale. With the anticipated profits, he will reinvest in the business. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows, and sheep.

loans.name: Norma Ileana

texts.es:
Norma de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, lleva 6 años con el negocio, habitante de la ciudad de León. Inicio vendiendo perfumes  a sus compañeros de trabajo cuando laboraba como secretaria. Sus primeros productos fueron Joyas de platas y perfumes los cuales vendía  al contado y al crédito. Al quedar sin trabajo se dedicó por completo a la venta de mercadería  variada, la mayoría de sus productos los vende a personas que trabajan en fábricas, bancos, oficinas al igual que las amas de casa. Es así como ha sobrevivido desde hace 6 años, ella desea lo futuro tener una tienda de variedades donde ofrezca productos de belleza, ropa variada, perfumes al por mayor.   
Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, joyas, perfumes , ropa interior para caballeros, damas y niños, calcetines, bolsos, camisetas etc.
texts.en:
Norma, aged 46, works selling clothing. She has worked in this business for 6 years. She lives in the city of León. She began selling perfumes to her colleagues when she worked as a secretary. Her first products were silver jewellery and perfumes, which she sold for cash and credit. On finding herself out of work she dedicated herself full-time to selling various merchandise. She sells the majority of her products to people who work in factories, banks, and offices, as well as housewives. She has survived in this way for 6 years. In the future, she wants to have an accessory shop where she will offer beauty products, various clothing, and perfumes wholesale. 

She is applying for this loan to buy cosmetics, jewellery, perfumes, and underwear for men, women and children, socks, handbags, vests, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewelery, perfumes, underwear for men, women and children, socks, handbags, vests etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI  est constitué de 5 femmes  mariées et 1 femme célibataire  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles  adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’oignon et des fruits et légumes à l’image de FANTA, assise devant au milieu avec un seau jaune. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 régimes de banane avec les paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of five married women and one single woman who are on average 36 years old with 4 children. They live in traditional extended families in the Niebala neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution where they are on their first loan.

This group of women is active in the retail trade of onions, fruits and vegetables. Fanta is an example, who is sitting at the middle with a yellow bucket. She intends to use the loan to buy 15 bunches of bananas from peasant producers. She sells at the market and through home delivery, retail for cash and credit to both women and men customers.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15.000 FCFA which will be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (or variety) store. Merlina has been in this business for ten years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan is a farmer with 18 years of experience. He sells tomatoes and cucumbers. He is applying for a loan to buy tomato seedlings, fertilizer, weed killer and a plastic covering for his greenhouse. This loan will help him to buy these items without any problem. His dream is to have enough money to build several greenhouses and continue a wide-range of planting. 

Aslan tries to spend all his time working. After his divorce he lives alone, as his two boys live with their mother. He loves his children and takes adequate care of their needs. His eldest son is of school age, and Aslan has already started the preparations to send him to school.

loans.use: To buy tomato seedlings, fertilizer, weed killer and a plastic covering for his greenhouse

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en: Halimah is a 26-year-old single lady. She has three siblings. A few years ago, Halimah started selling clothes at home and is still doing so. She now wants to increase her profits, so she applied to this youth loan in order to increase her stock of clothes and women's dresses.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and women's dresses

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells grocery items such as potatoes, vegetables and fruits as well. She has been in this business for the past year, and it has been profitable.

This is her second loan, and she plans to use the amount to buy more potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables such as cabbage and spinach. She also plans to buy mangoes, oranges and bananas. She will use the generated profits to pay for her children's school fees.

In the future, Teresia hopes to grow her business and make more income so that she can become financially stable and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Annie Ghislaine

texts.fr: Annie est une femme de 33 ans ;après ses études, elle s'est lancée dans la commercialisation du credit de communication.comme activité secondaire,elle est enseignante vacataire.avec ce crédit ,la cliente va augmenter son reseau de distribution.les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre de'acheter ou de louer une structure beaucoup plus confortable pour ses clients,et d'améliorer également les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Annie is a 33-year-old woman. Following her education, she embarked on the marketing of phone card credits. As a secondary activity she is a replacement teacher.

She will use this loan to expand her distribution network. The profits generated will enable her to buy or rent a structure that will be much more comfortable for her customers, and also to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: acquire a large quantity of phone credits

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock to her bar and clothing business

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is 26 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She helps her husband support their family by selling bed covers and blankets out of her home. She would like to increase her income, and is requesting this loan to acquire more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to acquire more bed covers and blankets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ziyodajon

texts.ru: Зиёдачон очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. С самых ранних лет она занималась шитьем. После занятий в школе она шила платье девушкам и женщинам своего кишлака. После окончания средней школы она не смогла поступить в университет, так как ее родители не имели денег для оплаты ее учебы. Итак, она осталась без высшего образования. После замужества она шила платья своим родственницам и родственникам мужа бесплатно. Теперь она хочет реализовать свое ремесло в бизнес, так как она прошла курс «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет предоставлять услугу портнихи местным жителям у себя дома. Жена ее брата будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 2000 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ziyodajon is a very hard-working and determined woman. She began sewing at an early age. After finishing school for the day, she used to sew dresses for girls and women of her village. When she graduated from high school, she was unable to attend university because her parents did not have the financial means to pay for her studies, so she was left without post-secondary education. After getting married, she sewed dresses for her female relatives and in-laws free of charge. As she has completed the course "Get Ahead" which was organised by the Association of Businesswomen, she now wants to turn her skills into a business. She will provide sewing services out of her home to local citizens, and her sister-in-law will assist her in running the business. Ziyodajon is seeking a loan of 2,000 US dollars to buy a sewing machine. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 38 year old single lady.  She has five brothers and one sister. She is a tailor that works in her own workshop making different styles of curtains. She is applying for a loan to buy new tailoring tools and some fabric.

loans.use: to buy new tailoring tools and some fabric.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 61 years old and the mother of three daughters. She runs a tailoring business out of her home and is requesting this loan to buy fabric so that she can make more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 32 years and married. For the last two years, she has been in the business of selling sugar and tea leaves, and is requesting this loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for about two years and earns an income of about KES. 9,800 a month. She has already taken out and repaid two previous loans and hopes to be a leading wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Khudoinazar

texts.ru: Худойназару 56 лет. Он женат и отец шестерых детей. Один его сын находится в загранице на заработках. Сам Худойназар вот уже 10 лет как занимается земледелием. Он арендует земельный участок, где выращивает пшеницу. В сезон посева Худойназар уже посеял пшеницу и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения. С этим намерением он обратился за кредитом. Худойназар берет кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. За счет прибыли с урожая он планирует расширить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en: Khudoinazar is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children. One of his sons is currently employed as a migrant worker abroad. For the last 10 years, Khudoinazar has been growing crops. He rents a plot of land where he grows wheat. He has already planted wheat during this planting season and now he needs mineral fertilizers to cultivate the land. For this reason, he is seeking a loan so that he can buy these fertilizers. He plans to use the profit generated by this loan to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sahaa

texts.en: Sahaa is 50 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She is earning a very good income by running a cosmetics shop, and would like to offer her customers new types of makeup and cosmetics. She is requesting this loan to buy these new items to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en: Ne’ma is a 55-year-old widow who earns a living by selling clothing and perfumes out of her home. She is requesting this loan to buy more clothing and perfume to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est constitué de 8 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales
à l’image de ALIMA assise au milieu de la rangée  de devant. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1,5 tonne de céréales avec les paysans producteurs de la zone. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of eight married women who are on average 46 years old with 5 children. They live in traditional extended families with husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons In the Niebala neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce.

To strengthen their financial capacity and improve their trade business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid correctly.

This group of women sells grain, like Alima who is sitting in the middle of the front row. She intends use the loan to buy 1.5 tons of grain from local peasant producers. She performs her sales at the market and through home delivery, at retail prices for cash and credit to both men and women customers.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25.000 FCFA to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman from Samburu, Kenya. She has been running a grocery store, which is well stocked with all kinds of essential goods, for more than two years. She is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so she can help her family. She is seeking this loan to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, vegetables etc. so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Kamwana

texts.en: Kamwana owns her food stall business where she works very hard every day. She is requesting this loan to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products needed to stock the store to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products needed to stock the store.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en: Nzara is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her poultry business. With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and feed to boost her business. She is grateful for Yehu and Kiva lenders for the support she has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Delmy Yolanda

texts.es:
Delmy, tiene una panadería, Ella tiene 52 años de edad, es divorciada con 4 hijos las edades de ellos oscilan entre los 10 y 18 años, el hijo mayor le ayuda en el negocio mientras que los demás estudian.
Ella tiene 5 años de poseer la panadería, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su labor la aprendió con una tía, además tiene 2 ayudantes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, miel de piña y leña. 
La inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios, aumentar la clientela  y por ende obtener más ingresos. Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y fortalecer más el negocio.
texts.en:
Delmy owns a bakery. She is 52 years old, divorced, and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18. Her oldest child helps with the business while the others are in school.

Delmy has owned her bakery for five years. She works Monday through Saturday. Delmy learned this trade from her aunt and now she has two assistants. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, yeast, pineapple honey, and firewood. This investment will increase her inventory and bring in more customers, thus resulting in more income. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family and to strengthen her business even more.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, pineapple honey, and firewood.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жамила начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство в после развала СССР на сегодня приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов и перепродажи скота. На сегодня, ее хозяйство насчитывает 3 коровы и в целях увеличения поголовья, Жамила обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и кобылы. Доходы Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес – деятельности за  увеличения скота
texts.en: Jamila is forty two years old, married and has three children.  In order to start providing a source of income for her family, she started a business with livestock.  She began this business with only 5,000 KGS after the collapse of the Soviet Union.  Today, it brings in around 17,000 KGS each month from the sale of milk and meat products as well as from the resale of cattle.  She now owns three cows.  With the goal of adding to this number, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 KGS to buy an additional cow and a horse.  She plans to reinvest the income provided by the loan back into the business by continuing to buy more animals.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and a horse

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 40 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Бахтиёр опытный дехканин. Он занимается земледелием уже 8 лет. Он арендует земельный участок, где выращивает хлопок. В сезон посева Бахтиёр уже посеял хлопок и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Бахтиёр запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений с целью получения богатого урожая.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a resident of the J.Rumy  region of Tajikistan.  He is forty years old, married and has three children.  He is an experienced farmer, as this has been his profession for eight years.  He rents a plot of land where he grows cotton.  He has already planted his crop for the season and now he needs mineral fertilizers.  He is asking for a loan to finance this purchase which will help him have a rich harvest.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale. She is grateful for this opportunty which she is receiving, since it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
